meanings.definition: To revert or become the property of the state due to a lack of legal heirs.
meanings.sent1: When the old man passed away without any family, his estate escheated to the state.
meanings.sent2: The abandoned house escheated to the government after years of neglect.
meanings.sent3: The unclaimed treasure chest escheated to the state, much to the surprise of the townspeople.
meanings.sent4: The forgotten land escheated to nature, reclaiming its own over time.
meanings.sent5: The lost artifact escheated to the museum, enriching its collection.

meanings.definition: Confiscated by the government due to abandonment or failure to pay debts.
meanings.sent1: The escheated property was put up for auction by the authorities.
meanings.sent2: The escheated funds were used to support public services in the city.
meanings.sent3: The escheated vehicle sat in the impound lot, waiting for its owner to claim it.
meanings.sent4: The escheated goods filled the warehouse, awaiting proper disposal.
meanings.sent5: The escheated belongings were sold off to cover the unpaid debts.
